Description: Oval cylindrical stamp-seal; the back is plain and perforated longitudinally; the face is incised with an abstract animal possible with long horns (maybe an ibex or antelope?) shown; animal has horns, a tail, and two random shapes one situated between animals front and hind legs and the other infront of the animal.
Curator's comments: Greville John Chester acquired objects from throughout the Middle East and Egypt with little to no documentation on specific object's origins existing.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
